intro: Pentacalia tolimensis, commonly known as the Tolima pentacalia, is a flowering plant native to Colombia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, humid environments within the Andes mountain range. It features opposite, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, blue or violet flowers. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
